alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 4:37PM EDT until May 03 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.4 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.3 feet on 03/22/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.2 Tue 4 pm 4.7 4.6 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM EDT.
